title: How to Make Urchin Cookies

steps.headline: Coarsely chop almonds using a food processor.
steps.description: Leave almonds in somewhat large pieces as the next step will finish the chopping process.

steps.headline: Add the flour, butter and sugar to the almonds.
Process until a smooth dough forms.
Roll out cookie dough so that is very thin, about 1/8-inch thick.
Cut out cookie dough using a 2-inch cookie cutter.
Cut out the center using a small round cutter or a clean metal sewing thimble.
steps.description: Alternatively, use a specialized cookie cutter that cuts out the rounds and automatically cuts out the center of the cookie. This specialized cookie cutter can be found in baking catalogs.

steps.headline: Place cut out cookie rounds on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper or silicone baking mat such as a Silipat.
Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until cookies test done.
Let cookies cool a few minutes on the cookie sheets.
Remove and let cookies cool on wire cooling racks.
Spread jam onto the uncut cookies.
Top the bottom layer with the cookies with the hole cut out.
Sprinkle cookies with powdered sugar and serve.

text: Coarsely chop almonds using a food processor. Leave almonds in somewhat large pieces as the next step will finish the chopping process. Add the flour, butter and sugar to the almonds.  Process until a smooth dough forms.  Chill.  Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Roll out cookie dough so that is very thin, about 1/8-inch thick.  Cut out cookie dough using a 2-inch cookie cutter.  Cut out the center using a small round cutter or a clean metal sewing thimble. Alternatively, use a specialized cookie cutter that cuts out the rounds and automatically cuts out the center of the cookie. This specialized cookie cutter can be found in baking catalogs. Place cut out cookie rounds on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper or silicone baking mat such as a Silipat.  Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until cookies test done.  Let cookies cool a few minutes on the cookie sheets.  Remove and let cookies cool on wire cooling racks.  Spread jam onto the uncut cookies.  Top the bottom layer with the cookies with the hole cut out.  Sprinkle cookies with powdered sugar and serve.  Makes about 20 sandwich cookies.
